item.title: Azure Networking
item.description: Create a virtual network using the Azure CLI A virtual network enables Azure resources, like virtual machines (VMs), to communicate privately with each other, and with the internet. In this quickstart, you learn how to create a virtual network. After creating a virtual network, you deploy two VMs into the virtual network. You then connect to the VMs from the internet, and communicate privately over the new virtual network. Create a resource group and a virtual network Before you can create a virtual network, you have to create a resource group to host the virtual network.
